intro: Manihot guaranitica subsp. boliviana, commonly known as the Bolivian arrowroot, is a perennial herb native to the Amazon Basin. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its tuberous roots, which are rich in starch. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and has heart-shaped leaves with a smooth surface. Its flowers are small and clustered, often greenish-yellow in color. The tubers are used as a food source and have a mild, slightly sweet flavor.
